content.description: Great route on the right side of the double roofs wall. Begin up easy terrain to the giant ledge. Navigate some challenging moves pulling past the lip and enter into extremely pumpy, overhanging climbing.
content.location: Rightmost line on the double roofs.

content.description: Get to the rock by scampering up the tree in the middle of the wall. This route tackles the line right in the center of the wall. Currently has two chain draws in the roofs.
content.location: Middle line on the Double Roofs Wall

content.description:
Begin deep in the cave. Boulder your way out to the lip and head up to a sit-down/lie-down/set-up-a-bivy-if-you-want rest before the head wall. Tackle the last roof and find one more boulder problem guarding the top.

 The first bolt on the route was only used as a directional for the beginning boulder problem. Stick clipping both the first and second bolts is recommended, unclipping the first as you pass it.

 This route can also be climbed without the opening boulder problem and goes at 5.11c/d A0.
content.location: Left most route on the Double Roofs Wall.

content.description: This one starts off strong and is a power sapper. Stick clip the first chain draw, start off the rock stack and climb through a crazy 20’ horizontal rail traverse through the roof. After the 3rd perma, pull the bulge and up to the big ledge 1/2 of the way up. Recharge you batteries and embark on much easier climbing on large chicken-heads the rest of the way. There used to be two small trees in front of this one.
content.location: Far left route on Double Roofs wall.

content.description: Really good, steep climbing just around the corner from the Haunted Wall. All of these routes are bisected by a giant, lay-down ledge (on Witchy Woman you could untie and walk off if you wanted...), but the climbing is still high quality and the rock quality is on par with the rest of Haunt: bullet. Once you’ve climbed out the Haunted Wall, these climbs should be next on your tick list.
